lines.text: This civilization is a worse disease than heart trouble or tuburculosis, and we can't escape it.
"I love you" is such an inadequate way of saying I love you. It doesn't quite describe how much it hurts sometimes.
I can be very objectionable.
My liver rushes in where angels fear to tread!
I'm sorry Louise I seldom hit a woman, but if you don't leave me alone I'll wind up kicking babies.
You've changed, David. Something's changed you.
No. We were through before I went to Canada. I suppose I *should* have put that in writing.
But now you're hard, and bitter.
Bored, I think, would be a bit closer to it.
You're not going to marry her. You're not good enough for her.
The mathematical chances of you killing me are very slim.
I'm not late, am I?
No, I just came in early to make a few practice swings.
How many have you had?
Oooh... easily!
Tommy, you may take a short rest and then start mixing me another!
Sometimes it's not your liver I'm worried about, it's your mind!

[on meeting again after long separation]
Aren't you going to kiss me?
I had no plans one way or the other.
All right, then. Go ahead and kiss me. You don't have to mean it.
[gives her the briefest peck]
I didn't expect you to mean it *that* little.
When a woman kisses me, Louise, she has to take pot luck.
It was pain that made her this way... only through greater pain and suffering beyond belief, can she get well again.
